posts.post_content: This is a good card. At pre-release, he wasn't as good as I imagined he'd be. In limited we have a great deal of artifact creatures that control him easily. Maybe I needed some nicer equipment for him. I can see this guy being better in constructed where artifact blockers are less commonplace and coloured removal spells are more important.

posts.post_content:
I have a rules question regarding interactions between a blocker with protection from the creature it's blocking, and the creature that's being blocked having trample. Let's say I'm attacking with a [Rapacious One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rapacious One), and it's blocked by an [Etched Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Champion) or anything else that has protection from red.   
  
Does my red trampler *not assign any damage to the defending player or planeswalker* on the basis that because the blocking creature has protection, it can't be assigned lethal damage by my red trampler? Or does trample damage still leak over while the would-be lethal damage to the blocker is prevented?  
  
EDIT: Ok, question answered. I looked more at the comprehensive rules. The damage is still assigned, although prevented, and the trample damage still gets through. Nice. (702.17b)  
  
My opinion is that this is a very mean artifact. I saw him used in a deck using artifact lands, Steel Overseer, and Energy Chamber. In an emperor game. It got almos... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I have a rules question regarding interactions between a blocker with protection from the creature it's blocking, and the creature that's being blocked having trample. Let's say I'm attacking with a Rapacious One, and it's blocked by an Etched Champion or anything else that has protection from red.

Does my red trampler not assign any damage to the defending player or planeswalker on the basis that because the blocking creature has protection, it can't be assigned lethal damage by my red trampler? Or does trample damage still leak over while the would-be lethal damage to the blocker is prevented?

EDIT: Ok, question answered. I looked more at the comprehensive rules. The damage is still assigned, although prevented, and the trample damage still gets through. Nice. (702.17b)

posts.post_content:
Up to this point in my limited hobby as a Magic the Gathering player, I've ended up with this extremely random mana source: Majority plains, about 18 forests, 15 forests and Islands, 12 Mountains and 10 swamps. So I'm thinking now, to invest in an Artifact deck, as it is probably the best way for me to NOT having to worry about mana source. Just chuck in some random mana and hope for the best. Although that'd be the sort of attitude for players who only want to aim for a top-deck hand :P! Anyways, I've been thinking of [Etched Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Champion) as well as [Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal) and Mox opal and other cards with similar abilities then the leech creatures such as the vampire [Black Coven Vampires](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Coven Vampires). Of course, I won't just based my deck around just thos as I'm also planning to get cards with the flash ability such as [tooth of Chiss-Goria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tooth of Chiss-Goria) (very old card) and others as well.
  
   
But could you guys give me some pointers to building s... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
